subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Do you get VERY tired from your sessions?
author: Lisby
full_text:
Robin, my personal experience sounds very much like yours, including  
the lingering tiredness. Frankly, I also end up quite cranky for a  
day or so. I thought at first that all this was a coincidence, but it  
happens every time I run a session. I'm not very fond of box  
"hangover," but I doubt it will put me off continuing.

Ann

On Feb 28, 2008, at 2:53 PM, Robin Searcy Henson wrote:

>
> I would guess it's very common because it's literally a spiritual- 
> mental-emotional-physical energy drain.  For the last two nights  
> I've been listening to my hacked radios in my motel room, without  
> recording, just to get in-tuned with them.  I've gotten totally  
> ovewhelmed with exhaustion both times, to the point of having to  
> stop within 10 minutes.  I agree that it's not related to physical  
> stamina.  The sessions are draining for them on the other side too,  
> right?  Do you recover from your tiredness momentarily or does it  
> take some time?  I've felt kind of "hung over" the next day, and  
> the tiredness is lingering.
>
> Robin
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: dead.science
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Wednesday, February 27, 2008 11:34 PM
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Do you get VERY tired from your sessions?
>
> I get very very tired from my sessions. I try to keep them to 10 min.
> because of this. Please remember I run marathons and have been a ham
> for over 20 years so I can listen to the radio for hours on end. I am
> not certain why this is happening. Just wondering if anybody has this
> problem.
> Rob.
>
>
>
>
